Package Server.Controllers

Class UserController

java.lang.Object
Server.Controllers.UserController
public class UserController
extends java.lang.Object
Provides access to user operations

  • Method Details

    • login

      public java.lang.String login​(java.lang.String username, java.lang.String password) throws java.sql.SQLException, java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException, java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException, java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException
      Creates a session token for a valid user
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the person to log in
      password - the password hash from the client
      Returns:
      a Response string with the session token in the data element
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException
      java.security.spec.InvalidKeySpecException
      java.security.NoSuchAlgorithmException
      java.io.UnsupportedEncodingException

    • logout

      public java.lang.String logout​(java.lang.String accessToken)
      Removes the user's session, logging them out.
      Parameters:
      accessToken - the access token to invalidate
      Returns:
      a Response string

    • validateUserRequest

      public boolean validateUserRequest​(java.lang.String accessToken)
      Checks an access token to see if the user is currently logged in.
      Parameters:
      accessToken - the access token to check
      Returns:
      true if the user is logged in, false if they are not.

      Parameters:

    • deleteUser

      public java.lang.String deleteUser​(java.lang.String username) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Removes the given user from the system. This will also invalidate any existing access tokens for the user
      Parameters:
      username - the username of the user to delete
      Returns:
      a Response string
      Throws:
      java.sql.SQLException

    • checkPermission

      public boolean checkPermission​(int userID, java.lang.String permission)
      Checks to see if the given user has a specific permission
      Parameters:
      userID - the user ID to check
      permission - the permission to check for
      Returns:
      true if the user has the permission, or false if they do not

      Returns:

    • getUserID

      public int getUserID​(java.lang.String username) throws java.sql.SQLException
      Fetches a userID for a user
      Parameters:
      username - the user to retrieve the userID from
      Returns:
      int the userID, or -1 if user not found

      java.sql.SQLException
